summary: Durable execution in LangGraph enables persistent, resumable workflows with checkpointing for human-in-the-loop and long-running tasks, ensuring determinism and replay.

structure.title: Durable execution
structure.summary: Durable execution in LangGraph saves workflow progress at checkpoints, enabling pause and resume for human-in-the-loop interactions and long-running tasks, with built-in persistence and deterministic design requirements.

nodes.title: Requirements
nodes.summary: Requirements for enabling durable execution in LangGraph, including persistence setup, thread identification, and handling non-deterministic operations.

nodes.path: durable-execution > Durable execution > Determinism and Consistent Replay
nodes.title: Determinism and Consistent Replay
nodes.summary: Explains how durable execution workflows resume by replaying from a starting point, requiring non-deterministic and side-effect operations to be wrapped in tasks or nodes for deterministic replay.

nodes.title: Durability modes
nodes.summary: LangGraph offers three durability modes (exit, async, sync) to balance performance and data consistency in workflow execution.

nodes.path: durable-execution > Durable execution > Using tasks in nodes
nodes.title: Using tasks in nodes
nodes.summary: Demonstrates converting multiple operations within a single node into tasks using LangGraph's @task decorator for cleaner code and parallel execution.

nodes.title: Resuming Workflows
nodes.summary: Explains how to resume workflows in durable execution, including pausing/resuming with interrupts and recovering from failures using checkpoints.

nodes.path: durable-execution > Durable execution > Starting Points for Resuming Workflows
nodes.title: Starting Points for Resuming Workflows
nodes.summary: Explains the starting points for resuming workflows in LangGraph's Durable Execution, depending on the API used (Graph API or Functional API) and whether a subgraph is involved.
